verses.verse: (Assurance of Victory for God’s Priest-King) Of David. A Psalm. (Mt 22.44; Mk 12.36; Lk 20.42; Acts 2.34; 1 Cor 15.25) The LORD says to my lord, “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.”
(Ps 2.9; 45.6) The LORD sends out from Zion your mighty scepter. Rule in the midst of your foes.

(Judg 5.2; Ps 96.9) Your people will offer themselves willingly on the day you lead your forces on the holy mountains. (Heb mss Symmachus Jerome: MT in holy splendor) From the womb of the morning, like dew, your youth (Cn: Heb the dew of your youth) will come to you.
(Heb 5.6, 10; 6.20; 7.11, 15, 21) The LORD has sworn and will not change his mind, “You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.” (Or forever, a rightful king by my edict)
(Ps 2.5, 12; 16.8; Rom 2.5; Rev 11.18) The Lord is at your right hand; he will shatter kings on the day of his wrath.
(Ps 68.21; Isa 2.4; 66.24) He will execute judgment among the nations, filling them with corpses; he will shatter heads over the wide earth.
(Ps 27.6) He will drink from the stream by the path; therefore he will lift up his head.
